basic-echo.name: Basic Echo
basic-echo.description: A basic HTTP proxy that demonstrates simple request/response handling. Perfect for understanding the fundamentals of proxy configuration and routing.

useCases.title: Learning & Testing
useCases.description: Understand proxy basics with a simple echo endpoint

useCases.title: Development
useCases.description: Quick prototyping and validation of HTTP flows

useCases.title: Health Checks
useCases.description: Simple endpoint for monitoring and diagnostics

http-external.name: External API Gateway
http-external.shortDescription: HTTP gateway for an API service
http-external.description: Full-featured HTTP gateway with path filtering, content-type negotiation, and flexible backend routing. Foundation for modern API integration.

useCases.title: API Gateway
useCases.description: Central proxy for backend service routing

useCases.title: Path-Based Routing
useCases.description: Route requests by URL path to different backends

useCases.title: Request Filtering
useCases.description: Filter and transform requests before forwarding

http-internal.name: Internal API Gateway
http-internal.shortDescription: HTTP backend to prevent external access to admin paths
http-internal.description: Full-featured HTTP gateway with path filtering, content-type negotiation, and flexible backend routing. Foundation for modern API integration.

useCases.title: Access control
useCases.description: Restrict access for admin services

useCases.title: VPN routing
useCases.description: Route internal, VPN requests to different services

useCases.title: Request Filtering
useCases.description: Filter and transform requests before forwarding

http-http.name: HTTP to HTTP
http-http.description: Basic HTTP API proxy demonstrating simple passthrough routing.

useCases.title: Simple Proxy
useCases.description: Proxy HTTP requests to a backend service

dicom-cstore-to-filesystem.name: DICOM C-STORE to Filesystem
dicom-cstore-to-filesystem.shortDescription: Store DICOM images to local filesystem
dicom-cstore-to-filesystem.description: Receive DICOM files via the C-STORE protocol and store them using the local filesystem backend.

useCases.title: Image Archival
useCases.description: Store incoming DICOM images to disk

useCases.title: Local PACS
useCases.description: Simple file-based image storage

http-to-dicom.name: DICOM Backend
http-to-dicom.shortDescription: HTTP to DICOM medical imaging proxy
http-to-dicom.description: Convert HTTP requests to DICOM operations (C-FIND, C-MOVE, C-STORE) targeting PACS systems. Enable REST access to DICOM infrastructure.

useCases.title: REST to DICOM
useCases.description: Access DICOM PACS systems via HTTP/REST API

useCases.title: Medical Imaging Integration
useCases.description: Query and retrieve DICOM studies from PACS

useCases.title: System Interoperability
useCases.description: Bridge modern APIs with legacy DICOM infrastructure

dicom-scp.name: DICOM Receiver (SCP)
dicom-scp.description: Receive DICOM images from medical modalities (CT, MRI, Ultrasound). Support C-ECHO, C-FIND, C-GET, and C-MOVE operations for PACS integration.

useCases.title: Image Reception
useCases.description: Receive DICOM C-STORE from medical devices

useCases.title: Study Routing
useCases.description: Route received studies to archive or processing

useCases.title: Modality Gateway
useCases.description: Central point for medical device connectivity

dicomweb-dicom.name: DICOMweb Gateway
dicomweb-dicom.description: DICOM Service Class Provider supporting web protocols. Enables browser-based access to medical imaging with C-ECHO, C-FIND, C-GET, C-MOVE operations.

useCases.title: Web Imaging Access
useCases.description: Access DICOM images through web protocols

useCases.title: Cloud Integration
useCases.description: Enable cloud-based DICOM workflows

useCases.title: Modern Viewer Support
useCases.description: Support web-based DICOM viewers and applications

fhir.name: FHIR Integration
fhir.description: Proxy for FHIR resources with authentication and validation. Routes healthcare data to FHIR servers with security headers and JSON extraction.

useCases.title: FHIR Server Integration
useCases.description: Connect to Firely or other FHIR servers with authentication

useCases.title: Healthcare Interoperability
useCases.description: Secure FHIR resource exchange between health systems

useCases.title: Data Extraction
useCases.description: Extract and route specific FHIR resources

fhir-dicom.name: FHIR to DICOM Integration
fhir-dicom.shortDescription: Unified clinical and imaging data pipeline
fhir-dicom.description: Full bidirectional pipeline converting between FHIR and DICOM formats. Links clinical orders with imaging studies and produces FHIR ImagingStudy bundles.

useCases.title: Radiology Workflow
useCases.description: Link FHIR radiology orders with DICOM imaging studies

useCases.title: Comprehensive Records
useCases.description: Create FHIR ImagingStudy bundles with clinical context

useCases.title: Data Normalization
useCases.description: Convert between FHIR and DICOM formats seamlessly

http-content-type.name: Content Type Handling
http-content-type.description: Handle multiple content types (JSON, FHIR JSON, DICOM JSON) automatically. Parse and route requests based on MIME type detection.

useCases.title: Format Negotiation
useCases.description: Automatically detect and handle multiple content types

useCases.title: Multi-Format Support
useCases.description: Accept JSON, FHIR+JSON, DICOM+JSON in same endpoint

useCases.title: Flexible Integration
useCases.description: Connect diverse systems with format adaptation

jmix.name: DICOM to JMIX
jmix.shortDescription: Share JMIX packages from DICOM services
jmix.description: Integrate JMIX applications with DICOM infrastructure. Secure proxy with performance optimization and schema validation.

useCases.title: JMIX to External Systems
useCases.description: Connect JMIX apps to third-party APIs and services

useCases.title: DICOM Integration
useCases.description: Link JMIX applications with medical imaging systems

useCases.title: Enterprise Integration
useCases.description: Enterprise-grade application connectivity

soap-to-json.name: SOAP to JSON Bridge
soap-to-json.shortDescription: Convert SOAP to modern JSON APIs
soap-to-json.description: Transform legacy SOAP messages to JSON format via JOLT. Enables modern client access to SOAP-based backend systems with JWT authentication.

useCases.title: Legacy System Modernization
useCases.description: Expose SOAP services as JSON APIs

useCases.title: Client Migration
useCases.description: Support both SOAP and JSON clients during transition

useCases.title: Format Translation
useCases.description: Automatic XML to JSON conversion with JOLT

transform.name: Data Transformation
transform.description: Transform and reshape JSON data using JOLT mappings. Convert between data formats, normalize schemas, and enrich data in flight.

useCases.title: Schema Conversion
useCases.description: Transform patient records to FHIR format

useCases.title: Data Normalization
useCases.description: Reshape and standardize JSON data

useCases.title: Format Translation
useCases.description: Convert between different data schemas

au-erequesting-http-to-fhir.name: AU eRequesting: HTTP to FHIR
au-erequesting-http-to-fhir.shortDescription: Convert HTTP service requests to AU eRequesting FHIR bundles
au-erequesting-http-to-fhir.description: Convert HTTP service requests to AU eRequesting FHIR bundles and back to HTTP responses.

useCases.title: eRequesting Integration
useCases.description: Integrate with the Australian eRequesting specification

useCases.title: FHIR Bundle Generation
useCases.description: Generate compliant FHIR bundles from HTTP requests

au-erequesting-fhir-to-http.name: AU eRequesting: FHIR to HTTP
au-erequesting-fhir-to-http.shortDescription: Accept AU eRequesting FHIR bundles and convert to HTTP API calls
au-erequesting-fhir-to-http.description: Accept AU eRequesting FHIR bundles and convert to HTTP API calls for backend services.

useCases.title: FHIR to REST
useCases.description: Convert FHIR bundles to backend REST calls

useCases.title: eRequesting Backend
useCases.description: Accept eRequesting messages for processing
